W. College London a prizvať aj ďalších relevantných partnerov pre ďalší rozvoj práce s mládežou.

In 2014, The Youth Profession Act passed through parliament hence Maltese youth workers on completion of their studies in Youth Work and 2 years youth work experience are awarded the Youth Work Warrant. In this relation, youth work students and youth workers need professional supervision. Currently, in Malta, there is no one trained in providing youth work supervision, hence such service is provided by experience counselors trained in supervision or youth workers who have been in the youth work field. This situation is similar in Estonia, whilst in England and Ireland there is a history of youth work supervision. Supervision for Youth Workers aims to create collaborations between the partners to share good supervision practices and techniques which are aimed primarily for youth workers. 

The Maltese Association of Youth Workers (MAY) together with another 3 partners from England (YMCA), Ireland (Ballyfermot Youth Service) and Estonia (Estonian Association of Youth Workers) will be focusing on the need for Youth Supervision, different supervision techniques, how this helps better the youth work provision, identify professional development, anticipating, avoiding & dealing with burnout and critical reflective thinking. MAY will be coordinating and hosting the 5 day training seminar which will be held at the Agenzija Zghazagh Activity Centre in Marsaxlokk, Malta. Dr Brian Belton will be facilitating the technical sessions supported by Maltese youth work trainers.  

Six qualified youth workers from each partner organisations will be involved in the training course. These youth workers have experience in working with young people, doing youth work supervision and/or assisting youth work students in their fieldwork placements.   

The 5 day training course activities will include theoretical information about supervision, supervision techniques, looking at case studies & personal experiences, use of peer group supervision, visits to youth work services in Malta, personal reflection journal and importance of leading a healthy life style for effective youth work.   The activities will be carried out through plenaries, group work, role play, keeping a journal, visits to youth work services and physical activity.

Through this training course the participants will be equipped with knowledge of what is supervision, how to conduct effective supervision, use of different techniques for supervision and how to promote critical reflective thinking. The foreseen impact is to better youth work provision by the participants; improve the quality of supervision provided to youth workers in the respective countries and have youth work supervision provided to youth workers by the participants. The partner countries will look into creating Continuous Professional Development for other youth workers as a multiplier effect of the training course.

WHYAt the most basic level, a sport activity well designed that incorporates the best value of sports – self-discipline, respect of the opponent, fair-play, team work, respecting rules – helps people in developing values and communication abilities needed to prevent and solve conflicts that appear in the day to day life. Sport can play a very important role in reducing the social tensions and the conflicts in communities and at national level, tackling the causes of that exclusion and proportioning an alternative entering point in the social and economic life of the communities.The partner consortium would like to carry out this project, because we believe that sport, as a unique tool, has the potential to provide mutual understanding among young people and the society in the EU member Countries.The partner organizations would like to organize this youth exchange, because we would like to give an opportunity for groups of young people from different countries to meet and learn about each other’s cultures. The project is a profound result of a common panning and project design of colleagues (representatives of the partner organizations), who met in different organizations. All partners exchanged desired project implementation and impact on the participants. The groups plan together their Youth Exchange around a theme of mutual interest - inter cultural exchange through outdoor activities.Participants: 29 participants from UK, Italy, Bulgaria and Poland.Activity 1: Youth ExchangeDates and Venue: 14-24 June 2016 in Varna (Bulgaria)OBJECTIVES- To understand the role of sports in the personal development and in social inclusion, in eliminating barriers, stereotypes and promoting communication.- To exchange of ideas and experiences between youngsters from different European countries on the use of sports for social inclusion - traditions, experiences, habits, exploring the nature, through outdoor activities.- To increase of the sense of initiative, leadership and team work.- The developing of fair-play and discipline.- To Rise awareness on healthy lifestyle.- To enable young people with low opportunities be aware of the chances promoted by European Youth Programmes and motivate them be actively take part in actions.The exchange will follow the non formal education approach: a combination of different creative and interactive methods will be used by the partner consortium team and adapted upon the profile of participants.  We will use diverse outdoor and phisical activities as learning methods.The impact of the project on the participants also reflected in the exchange of best practices for developing skills through sport and physical activities.Impact on the organizations will be seen by building capacity obtained by increasing the knowledge, experience and new initiatives.The project will create new networks by building strong friendships.Participants in the project, with the help and support of leaders of the project, will be encouraged to take follow-up activities in their communities to spread the influence of learning more, realizing new ERASMUS + projects, presentations, conferences and other activities.The multiplying effect is first of all achieved by the participants of the project spreading the ideas they got from here and realizing follow-up activities in their own countries.
Higher education student and staff mobility project
This is a higher education student and staff mobility project, please consult the website of the organisation to obtain additional details.

Youth employment is a part of EU employment policy, within the wider context of the “Europe 2020” growth and jobs strategy.
Europe is facing a high number of unemployed young people. The consequences of high unemployment are not mere economic, but Europe also risks a 'lost generation' of young people that, because they cannot participate in society, deals with low self-esteem, low motivation and even radicalization of thoughts and cynicism. It is a threat to the personal development of these young people as well as society and Europe as a whole.
 
Champions Factory LTD develops the project "Youth Leadership Academy" (YLA), because we believe that it is important for young people – as well as for the future of Europe - to be inspired to learn, to develop their talents, skills and attitudes towards themselves and towards society. Youth workers and youth leaders play an important role in supporting young people and they should, in our eyes, also play a vital role in supporting young people's reflection on their personal development. Creating awareness of skills (both new and old), a (re) gained confidence and inspiration will lead to empowerment of young people, promoting development of leadership skills and higher awareness of employability. Youth leadership in today’s Europe is a key issue for a greater economic development and for a deeper crises solution.

The idea of the project "Youth Leadership Academy" is innovative, because it connects different aspects -  entrepreneurship and leadership, sport, personal expression in sessions, presentations, business planning, etc. We are going to implement two inter-related training courses with practical sessions delivered from the main moderators, where the participants have the chance to develop their skills, knowledge and attitudes.

"Youth Leadership Academy" OBJECTIVES
-To share examples of good practices combating youth unemployment
- To develop youth workers skills, knowledge and attitudes, which reflects on their every day work.
-To development a sustainable networks among organizations in the youth field and sport.
-To familiarize youth workers with NFE and Education through Sport tools that focus on improving certain skills and attitudes and can significantly change the employability status of a young person.

Number of participants: 72, as out of the total number 22 are with fewer opportunities.
Profile: youth workers/leaders. Each organization will involve also one person with fewer opportunities to attend the event.

Methodology to be used during the project:
The partner consortium will follow quality and quantity streamlines in order to provide the most effective implementation of project activities and overall implementation of the project. 
For the flawless project management process, Champions Factory LTD will ensure quality face-to-face work meetings, online commutation and cooperation (e-mail, Skype, Social media, etc.); online-shared project resource documents (Dropbox, Huddle, Google Calendar etc.) among the Partner Consortium.
The work methodology (WM) will ensures high quality implemented project and involves synergy and stability between the following components:  scope management; communication management; change management/flexibility; quality management; cost management; risk management; resource management; time management.
This components, together with monitoring, evaluation; high proficiency and expertise of the involved staff; defined goals, objectives and coordinated events, will ensure that the project implementation is of high quality.

The main purpose of this project is to convey specific knowledge and methods to youth workers on youth leadership through NFE and sport; also we would like to convey the values of cohesion and enhance the promotion of cooperation between the organizers so that they can act as "multipliers" in their home countries.
We believe that the activities of YLA and follow-up can significantly contribute to the personal and professional development of the participants in the project. Young people will be able to identify youth leadership (in terms of the development of leadership through sport and NFE) to enrich the methods of work and establish contacts with other youth organizations that will make it possible to achieve these goals. They will become more confident as a basis for their future careers. 
These will effect positively in a long term perspective on the participants, participating organizations, respectively on the countries involved and European youth work as a general.

CONTEXT
Youth workers and youth leaders play an important role in supporting young people and they should, in our eyes, also play a vital role in supporting young people's reflection on their personal development. Creating awareness of skills (both new and old), a (re) gained confidence and inspiration will lead to empowerment of young people, promoting active participation in the society by youth, which will lead to sustainable development of the different social groups and countries in Europe. 
The concept of teamwork is extremely important to the success of any team and that is how sport can contribute to the development of skills in young people. The theme of sports will show the participants the importance of teamwork and we believe that sport is the best way to highlight and demonstrate sustainability. 

Champions Factory LTD would like to carry out this project, because we believe that sport, as a unique tool, has the potential to provide a sustainable development of the youth and the society in the EU member Countries and neighboring the European Union.
The main idea behind this project is to allow participating organizations and participants understand how they can use sport as a tool for sustainable development, e.g. educational.
Through "Sport for Sustainable Development"  youth workers will be involved and empowered to bring out the potential of the youngsters they work with and learn how to use sport and act as multipliers. 

"Sport for Sustainable Development" (SSD) AIMS TO:
- Develop long-term partnership among partner organizations
- Explore the meaning, relevance and potential of sport as a tool for sustainable development of youth.
- Explore and compare how NGOs within Europe work/approach/develop soft skills through sport in young people in order to provide the sustainable development of their areas/countries.
- Develop new Education through Sport tools, to be added to Champions Factory Tools Book
- Teach the participants how to develop soft skills in youth through sport in order to ensure sustainability of the population.

SSD is a multi activity project, which involves in total 60 youth workers in two interrelated and interconnected mobilities:  

ACTIVITY 1 - Seminar, which will be held in Bansko (Bulgaria) in the period 4-8 April 2017. It has the following objectives:
- To exchange good organizational practices
- To learn about sport as a tool for sustainable development and recognize its benefits
- To build new long-term perspective partnerships between the partner organizations 
- Understand the principles of Education For/By/Through Sport on theory and practice
- Experience Education through Sport(ETS) tools by International Sport and Culture Association

ACTIVITY 2 is a Training Course, which will be held in Santa Cruz de Tenerife (Spain) in the period 5-9 September 2017. It has the following objectives: 
- Develop 5 new Education through Sport tools
- Experience by practice diverse tools with different educational focus (discrimination, inclusion, health, etc.)
- Plan dissemination of created tools and learned outcomes
- Plan future partnerships.

AT ACTIVITY 1 IT IS CRUCIAL TO SETTLE COMMON UNDERSTANDING IN ALL PARTICIPANTS REGARDING EDUCATION BY FOR AND THROUGH SPORT - we need activity 1 in order to prepare the participants for the higher level OF ACTIVITY 2, WHERE THE PARTICIPANTS WILL, ALSREADY AS SKILLED YOUTH LEADERS, DEVELOP EDUCATION THROUGH SPORT (ETS) TOOLS, EXPERIMENT THEM AND PLAN THEIR PRACTICAL USE.
The project activities will be based on NFE methodologies and will be centered on participants’ input and experience as the main source of mutual learning. Diverse working methods will be used by the specialized in ETS Trainiers.

Tangible results of the project:
- 5 Education through Sport tools produced, which will serve as long-term tools to all participating organizations and the wide public, that will have the opportunity to download the tools free from Champions Factory web
- involvement of youth workers from the partner organizations.
- 10 video interviews of participants - 5 per event
- Two videos with duration 3-4 min after each activity, summarizing the importances of the activity.
- drop-box file with all Project materials
- organized follow-up activities -small scale event by all partners with the participants within 30 days after Activity 2

EUROPEAN ADDED VALUE will be foster through:
- International cooperation: By working together,on organizational level, the involved organizations will explore these differences and also identify similarities, moving towards models, practices and policies;
- Impact: To increase the quality of youth work on European and region of the world level;
- Strategy: The project will contribute to  achieve goals of the Europe 2020.

We believe that the project will significantly contribute to reach one of the main objectives of the EU Youth Strategy for 2010-18, which is to encourage young people to actively participate in society.

Modern vocational  training should include opportunities for transnational learning mobility. Practical experiences abroad empower people in different ways and at different levels. In addition to the acquisition of new professional skills, intercultural and language experiences can positively affect personality development and independent living. In times of inclusion disadvantaged target groups should not be excluded of this possibility. atempo is already ahead of its time  and offers supported work placements abroad for its participants for more than 10 years. 
The project Go Europe + 2.0 aims to continue this successful initiative and enable people with learning difficulties and disabilities to complete an internship abroad. People with learning difficulties and disabilities are people who need more time in learning or can not do or learn certain things and therefore need assistance in learning and work. The aim is to provide the greatest possible rapprochement between the offer of the receiving organization and the specific needs and learning and career goals of the beneficiaries. For beneficiaries, this means an extension of their professional and personal experience. Our experience shows that a stay abroad promotes increased professional motivation among the target group as well as the opportunity to acquire competences that are not offered in Austria. Furthermore, the project will help to strengthen existing collaborations between atempo and the receiving organizations on the one hand, and on the other hand, to establish or acquire new contacts and internships in other organizations.
A total of 10 individuals with learning difficulties and disabilities aged 15-25 years will become mobile and collect practical professional experiences in 5 partner organizations in Germany, Italy (South Tyrol), Luxembourg and United Kingdom. They will make placements in working  fields like office & administration, Information Technology, animal care and zoo keeping,  catering & tourism and food trade. The participants will usually travel in pairs. Depending on the degree of learning difficulties and disabilities or degree of need for assistance beneficiaries are usually supported by one or two supporters. 
We expect the following impacts: our trainees with disability will gain practical professional skills in the economic branches referred above, we will see  positive effects on the personality of the participants such as more self confidence,  increased independence in everyday life and  increased mobility skills in general and in particular abroad and improvement of foreign language skills (in England).

atempo is one of the leading inclusive social enterprises in Austria and advocates the equality of all people. A core area of atempo is inclusive adult education for people with learning difficulties and disabilities. People with learning difficulties and disabilities are individuals who need more time when learning or cannot learn or do certain things and therefore need support in learning and beginning to work. An important cornerstone of our training is the digital literacy and inclusion of our target group. Inspired by the conviction of revolutionary innovation potential of iPads and Tablets, we started our training program to expand into new mobile devices and media. Tablet training courses  will be offered internally for people with learning difficulties, as well as externally throughout European adult learning offers for adult educators, teachers, and social workers.

The aim of the mobility project "Inclusive Education on the move" is to make a major contribution to the pathway of atempo to become even more of a European education provider for digital basic education and inclusion. 
This project therefor aims to allow for a stronger connection of pedagogical methods and technical posibilities. This should lead to the development of new ways of learning that follow three main principles: Personalisation, Self-advocacy and and Activation. Specially identified further education measures should help to gain new teaching and learning methods, that then should be tested and if proven useful introduced into atempo´s educational offer. 
A total of nine staff members will be trained in new pedagogical methods for a stronger personalisation, activation and self-determination of learners through participation in European structured courses. The project is being prepared, monitored and evaluated by a project coordinator. This is both in the preparation, as well as the practical implementation the primary contact.
The course participation should show effects on different levels: benificiaries will gain the digital and pedagogical competences in the use of tablets, they will network and exchange experiences on a European level and this should ultimately improve quality and accuracy and thus the competitiveness of our national and international inclusive education offer. Thinking long term, the Erasmus+ mobility project should make a significant contribution to the strengthening of atempo's role as an inclusive, innovative, competent and European education provider and thus promote the (digital) inclusion of people with learning difficulties and disabilities in Europe.

In the European Union the statistics in physical inactivity of the population show a serious problem which affects all member states, however some of the governments managed to implement  effective strategies to contrast the worrying tendencies. Thus, one of the key priorities of the European Union in this regard is the promotion of Health Enhancing Physical Activity (HEPA) recommendations which is the first-ever Council recommendations in the field of sport.  Walking, cycling, dancing and other regular physical activities have significant benefits for health. It reduces the risk of cardiovascular disease, diabetes and some cancers, helps control weight, and contributes to mental well-being. Taking part in physical activity also increases opportunities for making friends and feeling part of the community.
We believe that young adults have crucial role in the promotion of health and physical activity for all. Young people can make difference through being the advocates of healthy behaviours, as they are the most dynamic group of the society.

“Together for active lifestyle” project is an initiative of committed young people to raise awareness on the importance of healthy and active lifestyle and to encourage young people to take active part in the promotion of these principles in their communities as well.  

Objectives:

- To foster inter-cultural exchange of traditions, experiences, habits, exploring the nature, through outdoor activities
- To raise  awareness about the importance of healthy and active living among young Europeans
- To developing young people’s skills to become more active and responsible Europeans citizens
- To empower young people to promote healthy and active living in their communities  - To providing opportunities for young people with fewer opportunities to develop their skills and competences through sport in intercultural environment

We will bring together 80 young people from different parts of Europe with big difference in upbringing, education, and cultural backgrounds and learn about health importances and cultures during two 8 days youth exchanges in Varna (Bulgaria) in Summer 2017. We chose Varna, as it is European Youth Capital 2017 and it will significantly contribute to reach the project objectives.

The setting for the project is an outdoor setting, as we believe that an outdoor environment and physical activities are very suitable to reach the project objectives as an informal learning environment. The methodology of the youth exchanges is based on non-formal education which involves Education Through Sport. ETS is a method of developing key competences in various aspects of life using sport and physical activities. Project coordinators are experienced users of ETS as they have already implemented youth-sport projects based on this learning approach. Sport and outdoor activities will be used as a tool to raise awareness on health related issues, the importance of mutual trust, respect, tolerance and teamwork. The program of the activities involves various sport activities, workshops, informal presentations based on the active participation of young people. Participants will be actively involved to the realisation of activities and they will be encouraged to contribute with their own knowledge.

We expect to reach a long range of tangible and intangible results, as some of the main ones are:
More knowledgable 80 Young people involved in International youth mobility
developed capacity of organisations
2 digital toolboxes with sport-based workshops, created by the participants
A video of 20 participants from the both activities, sharing their with feedback
Project logo
2 videos of each project activity
5 ideas for future projects/innitiatives together or with other partners, expanding our network
etc.

On the long term “Together for active lifestyle” will have a positive impact on the participants, the involved organizations, the local communities and the European Union. t is expected that the young people involved in the project will become more conscious of the importance of daily physical exercise and as a result they will become more active European citizens. After returning home, they will be more motivated to engage in sport activities and to involve their friends too. We expect that “Together for active lifestyle” will have substantial benefit for the participating organisations as well. By sharing expertise in the field of sport and exchanging working methods and non-formal education techniques, the quality of local and international youth work will be developed. 
The “Together for active lifestyle” project will offer visibility for the Erasmus Plus Youth program which is not well known among the young students of the campus. Through the  project we will also reach the older population as we promote ‘Sport for All’ regardless of origin, belief, economic situation and age.

Cultural Inclusion Sports Club is a multi-activity project designed to show how important the role of sport plays in the lives of young people’s life: it teaches persistence, courage, ability of losing and winning, team work. With this Youth Mobility project we would like to show that sport can also be a great bridge between cultures. Using different sport disciplines we intend to bring together people of different ethnicities, languages and various nationalities. In sport, the physical involvement of young people for the common goal will teach them team-work, appreciation of others and mutual respect. It is important to exercise sport according to the rules of fair play, which also should be applied in personal and professional life.

First activity is an 8 days Youth Exchange, which is a gathering of 20 young participants aged 17-26 years old and 5 group leaders from 5 countries (United Kingdom, Poland, Spain, Bulgaria and Lithuania) in Kent county, where we will organise team based soccer training activities, where the participants can learn the value of team work, cooperation and communication, but also together brainstorm to how to make the multicultural Europe more integrated. As a result, the participants in between the events will gain more knowledge in these issues, which will help them engage more in the latter Polish activity.

Second activity will take place in the Polish mountain town of Poronin between 2ns and 11th January 2018 and it will bring together 35 participants - 7 per country (including 1 leader). It will include a number of workshops aiming to discuss the topic of cultural differences and current European problems, and together we will try to find solutions to those issues. This will trigger interest in participants to follow more closely the current social-political situation. Also we plan to use outdoor methodologies of snow games and building together a snowman.

We, as young Europeans, want to rise to this challenge and create a project which: 
- will help in adaptation process the young people with distinct cultural backgrounds,
- will foster an attitude of openness among Europeans and to propagate an idea of one common Europe,
- will increase physical activity among young Europeans. 

The themes of the project are: Intercultural dialogue and acceptance, education and youth work through sport and outdoor activities, physical and mental health of youngsters, anti-discrimination, inclusion of marginalised youth through sport/outdoor youth work, Erasmus+ programme and European level projects in the youth field using sport/outdoor activities.
The project addresses the issues of racism, cultural diversity, mutual understanding, improving competences, healthy lifestyle, self-development, team work and non-formal education.

“Entrepreneurial Lab” is a two-stage international youth exchange project, which aims to gather 42 young people from 5 countries (United Kingdom, Bulgaria, Hungary, Poland and Turkey) and empower them with entrepreneurial attitudes and mindset.

Unemployment has been identified as a big concern in Europe and beyond. Today’s world is marked by widespread focus on economic development, technological advancement and global integration. Yet, we still witness widespread unemployment, especially among young people who are left outside the prosperity loop and who find it more and more difficult to access ever-changing labor markets.

The challenge of unemployment is even more sever among youth with fewer opportunities in rural and urban areas, where there is a  lack of education and opportunity. Employability and being able to make your decent living is directly related to life fulfillment and personal independence. Young people in the vicious cycle of unemployment suffer from frustration, depression, low self-esteem and even aggression and cynicism.

We believe that long term solution of this problem lies not in externalities of macro-economics or policy but in hearts and minds of young people. A renewed mindset is needed for young people to understand that even in the most difficult situations they have more control over their lives than they think and through entrepreneurial spirit, procactivity, creativity and strategic approach they can spot values, seize opportunities, assess and take calculated risks and grow. Instead of seeking a job, they can create one for themselves.

Overall aims & Objectives:
The main aim of this two-stage Youth Exchange is to create a platform and a process where 42 young people experience empowerment themselves and are equipped to empower others in their communities through exchange of ideas, stories, attitudes, techniques and tools that promote entrepreneurial spirit and skills of young people in general and young people with fewer opportunities in rural and urban areas in particular.

One journey: 2 stages!
The first stage will take place in Bulgaria, where participants will explore the subject, its challenges and opportunities. In between the first and the second stage participants will do research and observation in their local communities to find useful insights and opportunities for value creation, entrepreneurship and employability. The second stage of the exchange project, which will take place in Hungary will gather insights, learning, inspirations and experience of participants from their local communities and translate them into concrete business ideas and quality youth projects to be carried out under Erasmus + Programme.

Objectives of the first exchange:
- Explore the concept of unemployment and achieve a common understanding of youth employability.
- Analyze the current situation of young people today, especially the youth with fewer opportunities in rural and urban areas and understand their hopes, dreams fears and barriers for their personal development.
- Exploring obstacles and barriers to youth employability and ways to overcome them.
- Identify innovative tools and best practices and methods which can be transferred to working reality
- Form teams from participants to do research and observation in their local communities after they return in order to find useful insights and opportunities for value creation, entrepreneurship and employability.

Objectives of the second exchange:

- Gather insights, learning, inspirations and experience of participants from their local communities and translate them into concrete project ideas.
- Equip participants with knowledge and skills in the field of project management in order to enable them to develop quality youth projects.
- Identify existing resources for the young entrepreneurs and share know how on social enterprises to link youth with business and entrepreneurship.
- Promote Erasmus + Programme and explain how young people can be involved in it.
- Develop concrete business ideas and entrepreneurial initiatives.
- Develop concrete projects to be applied under Erasmus + Programme.
- Develop and publish an online catalogue of business ideas.

The project activities are based on non-formal learning methods and principles, inter-cultural dialogue and communication in including group discussions, interactive presentations, participants' lead workshops, team work, etc. Youthpass tool will be used throughout the project to help young people reflect regularly on their personal learning journeys and become more aware of their own learning The methodology of the project will stimulate active participation and sense of initiative and involvement of the learners.

It is certain that the current economic crisis is intertwined with the social fabric, thereby intensifying the humanitarian crisis and driving groups and young people into violent extremism-fanaticism, which are now one of the greatest dangers in E . The social fabric, irrespective of its socio-economic, religious or national background, has the need for further education and action to develop a meaningful framework of dialogue based on the basic principles of EU ideas such as mutual understanding, democracy, solidarity, etc.

It is therefore necessary to develop the existing structures for raising awareness and dealing with the phenomena of extremism and radicalization, involving all the actors involved and society in general. Because the phenomena of extremism and radicalization are varied and multi factorial issues that include social, psychological, religious, cultural, ideological dimensional dimensions, there is a great need for an adult learning mobility that will be thoroughly understood and sensitized to the phenomena of extremism and radicalization .

As a civil society organization, AID considers it its duty to prioritize the support of groups and especially of young people at risk, thus contributing to the mitigation of extremism and radicalization. The team of the 12 members to be trained through the 10-day mobility is the strategic pillar of our organization to help create a specialized team of support and dissemination of the phenomena of extremism and radicalization through the use art.

The present project sets out as a primary objective the provision of specialized knowledge in its action group on issues related to the development of social actions to deal with the two phenomena by exploiting the potential of art as the main tool.

The program was structured in a logical framework of dynamic series and all activities will have forms of experiential learning. It includes innovative activities focusing on the phenomena of extremism and radicalization, while the phenomenon will be approximated by the method of art. Topics of culture, history, prejudices and stereotypes, concepts of interculturalism and their complexity are discussed, and then the participants are trained in modern methods of coping with phenomena and corresponding tools and ways of organizing actions.

Through the implementation of this program, participants are expected to have learning outcomes in three main areas, at the level of knowledge, competences and attitudes.
Knowledge level:
1)To receive initial-basic knowledge about the phenomena of extremism and radicalization, where they will recognize the connection between phenomena and their connection to racism and hate speech
2)Identify ways, tools and methods of teaching to use art to deal with phenomena
Competences:
1)Develop innovative activities and modern educational tools-training methods associated with art
2)To acquire skills (verbal, etc.) in order to be able to sensitize groups of people who are negatively affected by such tendencies (not to marginalize others)
3)Enrich their knowledge with better methods of applying holistic approaches to support people and young people at risk
At attitude level:
1) Understanding and accepting the real causes that led people to such situations. In this way, they will feel the feelings that some of them may have experienced
2) To have a positive attitude and change attitudes and perceptions about people who have been victims of the extreme phenomena of extremism and radicalization

At national level, we want to become an exemplary pole in order to be able to sensitize other organizations / unions and others to work on phenomena and to open a path of continuous mutual support and intermodulation between organizations and local - regional networks.

At European level, our organization wishes to operate according to European standards, to develop partnerships with educational institutions and organizations working in the same fields in order to be able to continuously improve the quality of their work but also respectively to be able to participate in European movements for social cohesion.

The objective of Diversity Club is to empower youth through community involvement and grassroots inter-cultural movements to promote social inclusion of refugees, migrants, and of those of different backgrounds than their own.
 
Within our project we are aiming to inspire youth to create inter-cultural open spaces in local communities,  and to be involved in the service of all people who reside with them, those from all backgrounds, ethnicities and religions. Because of the multi-activity design of the project we want to stimulate a complete educational process and we strive for long-term project outcomes that will last far beyond the last day of activities.
 
Therefore, our project will be divided into 5 phases:
1. Initial preparations prior to the first activity
2. Youth Exchange taking place in Poland, young people aged 18-26 + 5 group leaders with no age limit, and the activities will be taking place between Poronin, where we will focus on:
- Analyzing the current involvement of young people in local communities especially the youth with fewer opportunities.
- Exploring inter-cultural obstacles and barriers to youth social actions and ways to overcome them.
- Identify innovative tools and best practices and methods, which can be transferred to youth local actions.
- Form teams from participants to make research and observations in their local communities upon their return home, in order to find useful insights and opportunities for social actions.
3. In between the first and the second activity participants will do research and observation in their local communities to find useful insights of social and cultural opportunities.
4. – The second Exchange in Morocco will explore contemporary refugee and migrant related challenges in Europe and inter-cultural community actions together with grassroots movements for improvement of social wellbeing.
- Explore the migration policy of the EU and involvement of civic society in the process.
- Encourage the contribution of youth in integration and social inclusion of the migrants and refugees into their communities.
- Gather insights, learning, inspirations and experience into project ideas.
- Equip participants with knowledge, skills and attitudes to enable them to develop social and inter-cultural youth projects.
- Develop ideas and social initiatives and put them into action.
 
Through the project we will help youth to reach their full potential through various workshops, 
discussions, games and simulations, which provide training and valuable experience to youth and support their future hiring process. Overall the goal of the project is to level out inequality and exclusion, thanks to active engagement of young people. In order to achieve that, we want to show young people the paths to build their own active communities and to equip them with skills and knowledge necessary to take the action.
